title: Is there any champion you have fun playing against?
body: Before you start posting, let me clarify. By fun to play against, I mean that you are having fun no matter if you are stomping, or they are.

replies.body:
{{champion:136}} He gives so much opportunity for counterplay, if he's winning against you, he deserves to.
{{champion:30}} Personal bias on this one since he's my main, but if he's winning against you it's because of one of two things, you are bad at dodging, or he has much better decison making than you do.  The champion has a lot of weaknesses that are very easy to exploit and pretty much anyone can do well against him if they're smart.
{{champion:14}} Never seen a Sion in game and thought, "oh that's bullshit." He's a straightforward, well balanced champ.
{{champion:19}} New Warwick is really fun to play against personally, he warns you that he's potentially coming when he's far away, can miss his ult, and is a very fair champ.
{{champion:115}} My opinion of him is, and always shall be; meh, you exist, you go do your thing. Never been mad at a Ziggs once.
I'll have to double Sion. Probably the only champ I can say I've ever felt fair playing against.

Full agreement with your list.

Personally I'd also add {{champion:101}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:161}} to my list, for the same reasons as Ziggs.

Also {{champion:119}}, because his axe catching minigame is interactive for both sides and even when he's kicking your arse it's a treat to watch a good Draven do their thing.
i dont agree with draven, the axe catching for free money and then at Q level 5 its something like +100% dmg on auto his axes do *give or take 15% im not fully certain*
Its always fun to play tag with a singed

No, not anymore at least.
Why is that?
Because I lost my favorite champion to play 1v1s and recently i've also started to play Eve, which is a jungler. And its quite different as I'm no longer fighting a 1v1 in mid or top.

I used to like playing against: Riven, Yasuo, Irelia, Nasus, Gnar, Teemo, Jayce. But this was back before Fiora got reworked. After Fiora got reworked, I stopped having fun playing against other champions, just having fun playing my champion (which used to be Akali and Diana after that).
Even to this date, i hate the Fiora rework.

Oh, I also liked to play vs Zed or Yasuo on mid back when Lulu mid was viable.
But ever since Fiora got reworked, I never have fun 'fighting' against some enemy champions.
I'm just not having fun fighting against certain champions such as:
{{champion:45}} - fucking aoe cage, disgusting
{{champion:41}} - like veigar, but with slow instead of stun.
Its just that their AoE zone of control is INSANELY BIG.

And ofc, {{champion:67}} {{champion:223}} and {{champion:18}} .
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I got no problem against the likes of: {{champion:17}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:142}} etc
I do ban Zoey quite often simply because she can one shot my adc/mid/top and that can shit the entire team fight from a looooong range. She just have a number issues with having to much damage or to low cooldowns.

However, for me the most disgusting champions are Veigar, Gankblank, Vayne, Tahm and Tristana.
Which is probably a very unpopular opinion.

Meh, at least Janna has counterplay. Even if she protects her carries, she's squishy as fuck. Tahm is tanky as fuck and protects the carry....
Vayne and Tristana just got to much self peal for a "hyper carry adc".

At least Kog stays in one fucking place. And without his team protecting him, he will fucking die. So, I can just switch my focus to 1shotting his janna/soraka/nami/lulu and then him. But if there's a Tahm..... fuck that. Vayne and Tristana doesn't even need peal from their team, if the player is good, they are pealing everything themselves...
Twich jungle is also disgusting. But only twich jungle, its very disgusting as a laner, because there's literally nothing you can do against it... he gets invisibility while you are lv1 and can just auto attack you with red buff to either kill you or force you to flash before even 2 minutes... Twich ADC is fine because he doesn't shit on your early game......... the idea of an 'late game adc' bringing pain in the early game (from minute 2 for fucks sake) its disgusting........ not even shako does that.

To be fair, pre-rework fiora was busted, she needed the rework. she had literally zero counter play. Her ult was point and click, also made her untargetable for a pretty decent amount of time (whilst healing her if she had life steal). Her q was another point and click double gap closer that also did a decent chunk of damage, and her riposte gave her free bonus AD. There was nothing you could do to counterplay her if she was ahead other than stack armor and hope for the best. And this isn't a bias opinion from some pre-rework fiora hater, because pre-rework fiora was one of my favorite champions to play. There was no way to balance her without completely gutting her and making her useless, in her old state.

her entire damage except W was auto attacked based, meaning: armor and auto attack damage reduction were effective against her.
her Q just like current Q can be interrupted by stuff like thresh's E, riven's 3rd Q, etc.
her E was just and Attack speed steroid, so, countered by attack speed slows.

her R made her go untargetable which means DoTs would still damage her, and due to her damage over time shields were very effective against her. She also had no control over her positioning, which means, the target of her ult would be allowed to choose where she would land at the end of her ultimate.
And ofc, she had no escapes. :)

So, that's counterplay and counter builds there. Its just that people had to be willing to take advantage of that.
But hey, you are free to have your own opinion that she was 'broken without counterplay'.

And since you can see, I used to play Akali (no skill shots) and Diana (only 1 skill shot) and now Eve (only 1 skill shot). I don't favor 'complicated' champions ^^
But Fiora was super fun to play, as it felt like "if I do good, I'm rewarded for it. If I do bad, I'm punished for it", don't know why, but that idea feels very fair to me.
Unlike the likes of Zed that. I press R, i try to combo you. I do well? you die, I do bad? oh well, i press R again and there's no problem ^^
old fiora ult was probably the most broken thing since prerework kassadin. Literally you werent safe anywhere and if you grouped you were way less safe. under tower? hah youre still dead af.

if you were grouped, her ult would hit multiple targets, dealing less damage to a single target. And after landing she would be defenseless since she couldn't counter everything like current fiora can 0.0
a single lux W would negate her entire ultimate.

her ult on a single target basically did just double the damage on that single target than if that would be an hit in a team fight ultimate
Her ult was basically just 4 enhanced auto attacks while invulnerable at the price of her positioning 0.0

Fizz can do the same amount of damage with his E...... and he has shorter cooldown and more control over it.
But hey, if you hated pre rework fiora, you are entitled to hate her.
Just like I'm entitled to hate the reworked version ^^

Because %max hp true damage and the ability to block ANYTHING is very 'balance'd :D

Stop pretending like Fiora didn't have the most massive iron dildo pre-rework. Her Q was a point-and-click gap closer with the same range as an ADC auto and it had double cast, so you couldn't even get away if you flashed the first dash. Not to mention her E gave her bonus MS so that she could stick to you regardless of you have higher base MS than her.

And her ult on a single-target did dealt over 1000 damage at max rank to a single target, excluding on-hit effects (Hydra, Botrk). You literally had to goon-squad her like Nasus just to stop her from 1 v 1ing almost everyone in the game, and even then, the Hydra splash damage and the horrendously high base damage meant that she would often kill at least 1 person before dying, likely two since she almost always won lane against everyone.

The fact that her %max hp damage is position dependent and needs to be procced by auto attacks means she has to actually move around in lane and teamfight properly to proc it, or time her ult use to effectively burst a target. Not to mention her current parry has an objectively lower invulnerability window than her ultimate and old W to work with, and only returns CC in the direction she casts it, so she actually needs to worry about positioning more than before. Armor tanks in particular absolutely eviscerate Fiora in lane, and even regular tanks that can time their CC chain and dodge W can trade effectively against her.

The mere fact that Fiora can miss and mess up now is already a huge improvement over pre-rework. Pre-rework couldn't fail anything, just like Garen. You could only mess up your macro-play or engage/disengage improperly.

yes, you are totally right. That's why Fiora pre rework had Malzahar like win ratio :)
Being such an overpowered and easy to play champion, she always had 53%+ win ratio for top lane
............................. not hahahahaha

If you failed as fiora before, you would die. That was the price for it.
If you fail as fiora now, you got the option to block stuff via parry, so, if you are good enough as a player (which I'm not) she's stronger than the previous iteration.
I'm bad, so, her being able to do more except: "succeed, damage the enemy and maybe kill them" and "fail and die", its way to hard ^^

https://www.leagueofgraphs.com/champions/stats/fiora

Except it was, the rework happened 3 years ago, and that was when her winrate dipped from a 53%+ average.

Tbh the new Fiora is just as frustrating. Her passive is unfun to play against (your weak point positions are choosen randomly, so they basically feel like if you had a number between 0 and 1 constantly in your head that indicated how much extra damage you'd take if engaged on right now). Her Q denies her passive either way, because hitting weak points with it is really easy if they are not literally on the opposite side. Her W is really infuriating because it can a) dodge CC that you already landed on her but have a delayed effect and b) has a shit ton of interactions that are not clear or intuitive at all. Bonus points because her Ultimate's only purpose is to make her immune to Ignite or minion aggro after killing you.

As a non-Fiora player, I feel reworked Fiora is just as frustrating and uninteractive as the old one.

While i agree new Fiora is still frustrating, i still don't think she's as frustrating as pre-rework fiora.

 And also, her vitals aren't 100% random. They always spawn on the front half of you, then the next one always spawns behind you, and so on, front back front back. The EXACT position of the vital changes every time, but it's always either on the front of you or behind you. So if a fiora hits a vital that's right in front of you, between you and her, the next one will always spawn somewhere behind you.

{{champion:136}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:427}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:163}} 

All have very clear strengths and weaknesses, as well as the ability to be punished for misplays and missing their abilities.

Can you go into detail for Sivir?

I lose to her often.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VcaRN6qk,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-02-02T17:17:53.269+0000)
>
> Can you go into detail for Sivir?
> 
> I lose to her often.

Sivir to me feels very "all or nothing". Her poke is extremely slow and telegraphed and her auto attack range is the lowest out of any ADC at 500 (yeah, people always said Vayne was balanced due to her 550 range, claiming that was low).

She's pretty much the epitome of how a marksman was supposed to kite due to her passive movement speed bonus. She has her spellshield which can reward skillful play, and her ult for a large burst of movement speed for a short duration, but has no dashes, blinks or hard CC. She hurts if you let her get in range and she has a decent enchanter or tank to peel for her, but she can also be easily focused.

As a diver bruiser player I cannot agree with Shen. He out roams me and can nullify half of my trades (I trade about once every 10 seconds if allowed when playing kled). But other thank that, spot on.

i dont have fun playing against a single particular champion, however i do have fun match ups. for example darius vs garen is pretty fun. its usually a back and forth with who can get there ult off first, and both players have to be careful when at low health in order to not get executed. thematically its great too.

support vs support or tank vs tank is usually fun for me too because no one is dying in .5 seconds.

{{champion:432}} 
He is just so fun. I have a lot of fun playing with him. When I see him in enemy team it is also fun , no mattter what. Just because of his gameplay with this insane damage, stuns, E+stuns, sometimes Ult.

" I have fun raping her and getting raped by her , and I freaking love getting killed by her Tibbers after killing her "


( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

Yes, most of them really. I'll caveat that of course I'm having more fun if I'm winning or it's even. Also that if someone is like 15/0 at 10 min and can crush everyone instantly,  then off course it's not fun. The game is over at that point though,  and it wasn't necessarily unfun for the first 7 min. 

The only ones that aren't:

Ezreal
Evelyn
Fizz
Pantheon
Shaco
Thresh
Yasuo

With borderline being:
Tahm 
Soraka
Janna
Teemo

Your question is an oxymoron, playing video games is fun, playing league of legends is fun, playing against other players is fun, playing against other champions played by those players is fun, it's implicit, of course you have fun playing against most of the champions in the game, otherwise you wouldn't be playing the game in the first place.

Playing video games is fun, true. But that does not make this an oxymoron because it doesn't invalidate certain parts of video games:

Frustration. Lets put this in terms of difficulty:

Some games are set up to be challenging. However, people sometimes go beyond what the word "challenge" is and makes it more "frustrating" to beat than challenging. Lets take fighting games for instance. Playing through story mode on Medium is fun and a slight challenge. Some people may find it too easy so step up by playing on Hard. Hard is probably easy for those who sink good time into the game.

However, even hardcore players of fighting games will tell you that the hardest difficulty on them are BS. It's BS because the AI reads inputs and displays the perfect counter to everything you do. The only way to win through this game mode is to cheese and abuse AI patterns. This is far from "fun" and more on the side of frustration for anyone that wanted a challenge and even less fun for those who only cheese to beat it for "achievements" purposes.

if you are playing league of legends, you are having more fun than you are getting frustrated, if you don't have fun and you are still playing, you have a problem and you should find a new hobby asap.
Anndddd you missed the point... good talk.

I enjoy playing against {{champion:432}} 

He's really goofy and unpredictable with his E if you catch him while he's roaming around. Toeing the line against him can lead to a lot of hilarious situations; especially when they're making those genius plays to juke you around/dodge your skillshot or gap-closer. A good bard player is easy to recognize because they are often as creative as they are practiced from a game-mechanics point-of-view.

I personally enjoy fighting most divers/assassins as Quinn. It’s always a volatile, high-octane matchup where if either one of us makes a single mistake, it’s curtains for us each fight. If they engage carelessly, I Vault off of their dash and disrupt it before blinding them. If I get too antsy and Vault agressively, I’m bursted down.

as a riven main, all these champions are fun to lane against simply because there is room for outplaying.

there are times i can go in and times i cant go in.

there are times of weakness and times of strength.

i cant just run in blind and win.

i cant just be beaten whenever they jump on me.


its called "skill expression"

riot HATES this term and is working their ass off to remove it so terrible autofilled top laners can SHIT on you without room for counterplay.
Morde main: illaio. Yasou. Fiora.
As lissandra i love playing against zed, always interesting

Crucify me, but {{champion:142}} .

I play a lot of her so I know basically everything she can do, so it really just has me thinking in the back of my head "don't go there, she could bubble me real easily" or using minions to block her skillshots, and basically it just keeps me on the edge of my seat the whole game, because if I screw up past level 6, I'm likely dead, but if I play well I can safely prevent her from having an impact late.

{{champion:240}} 

Save for the bullshit when it feels like you should have gotten Skaarl's health bar back, but didn't(and vice-versa the other way), Kled is a great character. His Q is a narrow skillshot that doesn't feel overly punishing to most characters, but can be exceptionally dangerous if you don't respect the proc.

His W forces both players to consider the risk-reward of going for that 4th hit, or backing off. If you can't punish it, you need to get away from his Q. 

His E has moments where it feels bad to play against, but that's mainly in tandem with his Q, and in the rare instance you chase someone over walls with it. Using it can feel pointless except for this very combo. That kinda stinks, but it's better to play against for that same reason.

His ult is just generally a cool ability that shows you exactly what area to avoid. It's great for both sides.

If he hits everything, it's very likely he'll wreck you. If he misses his Q, odds are you're fine, save for some edge-cases with exceptionally squishy characters.

{{champion:14}} is also good, but people have already gone on at length about him.

{{champion:222}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:15}} I actually enjoy most traditional ADC matchups like these. (I hate {{champion:119}} and {{champion:67}}.) Back when bot lane wasn't so snowbally, it was fun to see if I could outduel them.

{{champion:22}} Know thine enemy.

Believe it or not, I actually enjoy laning against {{champion:142}}. She frustrated me a ton at first, but after I got a feel for her abilities and play patterns, I feel like it's all a matter of who's more skilled. (I mostly play {{champion:163}} and {{champion:55}} mid.)

Warwick and Sion are the only ones that is interesting to play.

With Warwick, nothing happens without you having some warning. You know you are being hunted, and you can either get to a safe position, or prepare a counter attack.

Sion is kinda like this. He’s a cc monster, but to get as much cc as possible, he needs to charge it. He also pretty predictable, so if you are getting destroyed by him, it’s partly your fault. And no matter what lane you are in, if you hear that ult sound, everyone is terrified. However, late game with a metric butt ton of health on top of health items and resistances is an annoyance, but he doesn’t do much damage. He is a tank period. A big, bulky, lumbering giant that soaks up as much damage as possible, and sets up plays for his teammates.
It's fun to play vs Thresh because you can always predict and dodge an average thresh's hooks. But a god level thresh is going to require you to completely change your juking game.
{{champion:157}}
Immobile mages with no mobility in general and skillshot reliant, like Xerath, Vel'Koz or Brand, room for outplay from both parts

that's why they complain about vayne yasuo zoe  kata

for example nunu  jumped to high ban rate because of damage buff  not because he is super tanky 


let's face it tankiness is not good to win games  and damage  give you more than just killing people = killing objectives fast with dmg + tower shred with dmg + wave clear with dmg 

what tankiness gives ? no shit  just a meat ball  moving trying hard to kill a canon minion LUL 

 with exception that CC wins team fights because when you cc some one he can't do *damage* to you 

the damage in this game is  so essential 

now nerf zoe's / kata / zed / yasuo damage 

and see tomorow their ban rates and pick rates 

they suddenly becomes (unfun to play with and fun to play against) 

hell even rammus will be fun to play if he can one shot you 

because killing other opponents is the fun not the kits or whatever reason

I think most people complain about Kat because of her damage. However the thing that's most unfun about Yas and Vayne are their cock block mechanics. They do a lot of damage, but they also have their anti-fun mechanics. Yasuo can make half of the champ roster useless for around 5 seconds by pressing a single button. Even if someone gets the jump on Vayne, she can just press E to knock them away or stun them, then just delete them.

even ornn before he got the buff was considered trash because they didn't "buff his dmg" not  because he was super tanky 

i can be super tanky with garen but 0 dmg 

but ornn gets free dmg from his tanky items which made him op 

the damage is so essential in this game
